intro: Struthanthus nudipes, commonly known as the nakedfoot struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Loasaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its root system is adapted to arid conditions, allowing it to survive in sandy or rocky soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
